Class Team

  • java.lang.Object
    • Team

  • public class Team
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that represents a Team of Football Players. Stores a list of all the Players on the Team and computes some statistics about the Team.
    Version:
    2018-09-10
    Author:
    Stephen

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected java.util.ArrayList<Player> players
      The list of Players on the Team.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Team​(java.lang.String filename)
      Constructor, takes in a csv file of Players and stores them in a list.

    • Field Detail

      • players

        protected java.util.ArrayList<Player> players
        The list of Players on the Team. Note: because this variable has the "protected" access modifier, you may directly access this variable in unit tests.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Team

        public Team​(java.lang.String filename)
        Constructor, takes in a csv file of Players and stores them in a list.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the csv file containing a list of Players, one Player on each line. Assumes that the csv file is at the top level of the project (not within any folders; at the same level as src and TODO.json).

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public void read​(java.lang.String filename)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a list of players from a CSV file. Each line of the csv represents a single Player. The first line of the csv denotes the order of the fields, you should not construct a player from the first line.
        Parameters:
        filename - The file to read from.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writePlayers

        public void writePlayers​(java.lang.String filename)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Writes out information about the Players in the Team. Specifically, loop through the list of players and add each toString to the output (adding each new toString to the end of the previous, without any additional formatting).
        Parameters:
        filename - the file to write out to (should be a .txt file). Assumes that the file is at the top level of the project (not within any folders; at the same level as src and TODO.json).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writePlayers

        public void writePlayers​(java.lang.String filename,
                         java.lang.String homeState)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Writes out information about a subset of Players in the Team. Only writes out information about players from a given home state. Specifically, loop through the list of players and add each toString to the output (adding each new toString to the end of the previous, without any additional formatting).
        Parameters:
        filename - the file to write out to (should be a .txt file). Assumes that the file is at the top level of the project (not within any folders; at the same level as src and TODO.json).
        homeState - Players with a home state matching this input will have their information written out to the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeStatistics

        public void writeStatistics​(java.lang.String filename)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Formats and writes out information about the statistics of a Team. Specifically, write out information in the following format: "Total Height: (result of computeTotalHeight())\nLightest Player: (name of Player returned by lightestPlayer()\n)"
        Parameters:
        filename - the file to write out to (should be a .txt file). Assumes that the file is at the top level of the project (not within any folders; at the same level as src and TODO.json).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • computeTotalHeight

        public double computeTotalHeight​()
        Gives the total height of the Team.
        Returns:
        Sum of the heights of the Players in the Team.

      • playersFromState

        public java.util.ArrayList<Player> playersFromState​(java.lang.String state)
        Calculates the subset of players which are from a given state.
        Parameters:
        state - Players with a home state matching this input String "state" should be aggregated and returned.
        Returns:
        An arraylist containing all players whose homeState is equal to the input variable "state".

      • anyPlayersFromCityName

        public boolean anyPlayersFromCityName​(java.lang.String cityName)
        Determines if any players are from a city with a given name (ignores the states).
        Parameters:
        cityName - the name to compare Player's cities to.
        Returns:
        True if there is a player from a city with a name matching the input variable "cityName", else false.

      • lightestPlayer

        public Player lightestPlayer​()
        Finds the lightest Player (lowest weight variable).
        Returns:
        A Player object that has the lowest weight variable out of all Players recorded. If there are no players on the team, return null.
